author: kelleymuro
title: Kingdom Builder
description: Most low level users in crypto's first and only experience with crypto is on Coinbase and then nothing after that.

assessments.note: I find this proposal to be not sufficiently mature, although the idea of a  social platform is worthy of consideration. However, it is important to keep in mind that many social platforms exist even in the centralized world and most of them are worth nothing. The very problem statement might be a problem for me as it specifies that "most low level users in crypto's first and only experience with crypto is on Coinbase and then nothing after that". Not sure how big of a problem is that and whether the statement is true at all. Is a general statement and the the proposal is designed to solve that " problem statement". Most people's experience with cash is to use it as much as they need and that in my view is not a "problem". The problem might be providing more different uses that will make crypto useful, not inventing new ways of engaging consumers in order to "fool them" (my words) to use it more. The proposed solution "creation of a platform that anyone can join, buy crypto and actively transact on the blockchain (maybe without even knowing it)" seems impossible because of the effective legislation that is in place around crypto. Most crypto exchanges will require cystomers to go through a crypto KYC (Know Your Customer) process before buying and cashing out and just swapping an exchange for a "world building social platform" will not exclude this platform from KYC requirements. This issue does not seem to be addressed although the proposal does propose a platform for buying crypto. So I am not sure whether the proposal will be able to result in a novel and viable application that will attract users in real life. So, I would include more information about the restrictions in buying crypto and trading it and how this will be addressed.
proposer is asking for the entire amount of this fund. This requires very strong evidence that the proposal "will provide the most value for end users in 2021". This has not been given.

Honestly, It is a very cool idea for a social platform, although it requires massive adoption to be successful, and the proposer gives no outline as to how this will be achieved. Because the proposer only offers a neat concept, but no technical plan or roadmap, it is unlikely that it will add a significant number of users to the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposal is a cryptocurrency-backed Patron or Reddit type of site. However, the plan is nascent and needs extensive work before it evolves into a practical site that will have the desired network effect.

Interesting idea. The proposal intends to onboard people to the community by gamifying the blockchain. It's not entirely clear if the author intends to do that by building an actual game with an own GUI or do this by means of text through a browser. Be careful with potentially offering sexual content on a platform where 'anyone can join', though.

The problem description and solution are reasonable.

The proposal described is within the scope of this challenge, as it would be an application/dapp inspired by Patreon, OnlyFans, which are centralized subscription services that are increasingly popular.

The absence of metrics and goals makes it difficult to assess the impact of this challenge, so I recommend that the proposer include these items.

The core idea could be promising to the objective of the challenge of expanding the Cardano ecosystem by attracting new users and driving adoption. However a clearer implementation plan and more details would be required to fulfil the vision outlined in the proposal.

"Presenting cryptocurrency to the masses in a fun and creative way", as the author of the proposal itself exemplified in his text, is the main objective of this idea. I found this proposal very interesting, because it intends to create an application (as I understand it) where people can choose to make a "kingdom", with different contents, or participate in an existing kingdom, and within these "universes" transactions are made via ADA, NFTs and etc. It is a proposal similar to some things that already exist, such as OnlyFans, but which innovates when it intends to include the blockchain of practice in people's daily lives, who often see this type of activity as something a little distant from their realities. I just don't know how the issue of making decisions would get involved in this app, in my opinion it would be another way of attracting new members to the community.

The proposal is applying for USD250,000 in funding and in such a proposal I would expect to see much much much more detailed information about timetables, detailed professional experience with links verifying successful projects completed and a super duper budget breakdown that is clearly itemized and easy to follow and understand. There is a lot of information about the social world/platform - but an idea is different from a funding proposal. A successful funding proposal needs to be on the cusp of realization, one step away from full implementation - practically ready-to-go as soon as funding is made available. In this case, I don't see those required elements. The experience listed states: "I have been developing apps for the last 5 years and have helped scale multiple saas companies to 50k+ mrr." My quibble with this listed experience is that anyone can develop apps, what would prove relevant experience is successful apps or a trend of building better and more successful apps. What I am trying to say is that verifiable app building experience is best demonstrated by showing examples. Also it would be great if those multiple saas companies that have been helped to scale to 50k+ mrr were listed by name ... as well as the exact contribution of the proposer. Finally, I also do not think the  proposer has demonstrated that he sufficiently considered challenges and risks that might derail his ambitious project.
No detailed plan. Seems like the proposer want to make a game, but has not detailed any real game mechanics and doesn't have any game making experience.
The proposer only gives a vague unverified experience and the proposal demonstrates their lack of technical understanding regarding Cardano. This in no way justifies the funds requested.

The proposer has claimed 5 years of experience in app development however has not presented any verifiable references. Moreover, the proposal has a huge scope, and a relatively large team will be required to implement it on any scale successfully.

The proposer has presented a plan to how the product would look like, but no plan on how to implement it. There is mention of other platforms who would function as the first adopters, but no elaboration as to why they would want to onboard. There would be a marketing plan needed to get the platform known. 
The proposer has relevant experience as an app developer. Yet it is not clear from the proposal if it is the intention to create this DApp alone or if there is a team necessary to perform the development. To make this evident, it is advised to use the seek-tags to try and find the right people.

The proposer described his experience in developing apps for the last 5 years, but there are no details about the work done or a link to make it possible to check his qualifications / experience.

There is no mention of experience with development in blockchains or smart contracts, I recommend clarifying this point.

There is a reasonable rationale and a promising concept, but it lacks a structured plan and within what we expect from the proposals in Catalyst. I recommend including a roadmap, details on budget breakdown and other information described in the Catalyst documentation.

The proposer doesn't provide enough information about his background, credentials or links to previous works. The proposal lacks a detailed plan, roadmap or broken down budget. I would advise adding all these elements in future version of the proposal, as well as an estimated start date.

The author says he has more than 5 years of experience with application development and with the growth of some companies, which is certainly beneficial for the project. However, I believe that this proposal is very complex and needs a large and experienced team to work, because here it is intended to create a new kind of social network, which is also a game and a means of establishing financial transactions via ADA… there are many variables that will need professionals in the areas of technology, design, finance and etc. Therefore, I believe that the author is indeed qualified to be part of the team, but that this needs to be better planned.

The auditability of this proposal is relatively weak. I do not see a well-defined roadmap that would inspire confidence in a Project Catalyst voter. Voters are essentially deciding to delegate treasury funds for proposals. Any proposal stands a much better chance to be voted for if it includes specific milestones and a timetable with key stages linked to time for realization. 

The inclusion of key metrics for success and performance would have helped make this proposal easily auditable and it would be easy to assess its ultimate feasibility. As it stands now, it would benefit from a more targeted vision on the nitty-gritty details concerning realization.
Not clear how it meets the challenge. No detailed plan, thus unlikely to be successful. Requested entire fund of 250,000.
The proposal lacks any auditable points. No goals or breakdown of costs are given. I have zero confidence that the 250k in funds requested will be used efficiently.
The proposal has no cost breakdown or phase-wise tasks that will be carried out. It won't be easy to audit the progress without such a detailed analysis.

It is good that there is thought of possible restrictions to the execution of the plan. But as we're speaking of a DApp with a large amount of personal content, it could get complicated in terms of copyright. So there is a need to incorporate legalities to make sure that everything is covered. 
Furthermore I'd advise to include a budget breakdown to justify the requested amount. It doesn't really matter if the amount is high or low, but it does matter if there is an explanation to it so the voterbase understands why something might cost any given amount. 
Finally, creating the DApp, onboarding other platforms and users and supporting it post-release would total to quite some work. A roadmap is needed to keep track.

No information has been included to enable the proposal to be audited. I recommend including roadmap, milestones, metrics, KPIs, details about the team and budget allocation, as stated in the Catalyst documentation.

It would represent a challenge for the community to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposal in addressing the goal of increasing adoption of the Cardano blockchain as long as no metrics for auditing the proposal are included. I would suggest including a clear set of KPIs and defined deliverables in a future iteration of the proposal.

In this part, the author did not include how he intends to carry out his project, did not establish steps or an intended budget. Unfortunately, there is no information to be analyzed. If an action plan was included, how the money would be spent, some expectation of return on investments, we could have a basis for the next steps to be taken in this project.

solution: I want to create a a platform that anyone can join, buy crypto and actively transact on the blockchain (maybe without even knowing it)
experience: I have been developing apps for the last 5 years and have helped scale multiple saas companies to 50k+ mrr.
